headline: Roasted New Red Potatoes
description: Roasted red potatoes tossed with olive oil, salt, and pepper, then cooked in the oven until tender in the middle and perfectly crisp on the outside.

video.description: See how to make easy roasted red potatoes.
video.name: Roasted New Red Potatoes

name: Roasted New Red Potatoes
recipeIngredient: 3 pounds small red new potatoes, halved
1 teaspoon salt and freshly ground black pepper

recipeInstructions.text: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C) and adjust the oven rack to the lowest position.
Toss potatoes with oil, salt, and pepper in a bowl. Arrange, cut-side down, on a rimmed cookie sheet or jellyroll pan.
Roast potatoes in the preheated oven until tender and golden brown, 20 to 30 minutes. Transfer to a serving dish.

review.reviewBody: I used this recipe as a base, which was great, but I added my own twist to it. I quartered the small red potatoes. I then quarts a yellow sweet onion and peeled it into layers. I put both the potatoes and onions in a bowl, drizzled olive oil and sprinkled garlic powder, black pepper and salt over them. Tossed them a bit and then added more of the oil and seasonings before tossing them again. I them layered them on a cookie sheet that was lined with foil and sprayed with butter spray. I then sprinkled alittle seasoning and garlic salt before baking it for 10 minutes. After 10 minutes, I moved around the potatoes and onions to make sure they weren't sticking and then I baked for an additional 15 minutes. I then covered it with shredded parmesian cheese and let it sit in the (turned off) oven for a few minutes. Very yummy!

Recipe is great, all the bad reviews are from people who don't think about things like, maybe if my oven only heats from the bottom I should use a higher rack, or maybe I should actually watch the food instead of blindly following times.
Yummy, easy to make and crispy on the outside tender on the inside.

This recipe is easy and So Good. I add a little garlic salt to mine. Also I cut them into smaller pieces. I have to flip them several time but 25-30 minutes is about right. I'm cooking them now as I'm typing

Simple recipe for a busy weekday side dish. The only extra ingredient I added was a bit of garlic powder. This is best made with small new potatoes. If you’re not sure which ones to buy, look for the small red potatoes. Make sure to place them cut side down and put on the bottom rack in the oven. My husband and I loved them.
Great simple side dish!
We quartered the potatoes instead of halving. Then we boiled them for about 10 minutes. Finally, we roughed them up and followed the rest of the recipe. They turned out great!
Easy,basic recipe. The kind I like. Delicious 😋
Exactly as written these are the bomb

I think I would have loved the results if it hadn't all stuck pretty badly to the pan. I used a baking dish lined with foil, and turned/stirred the potatoes after 15 minutes. Then I stirred again after 20 minutes, and they were beginning to stick - by the end of the cooking time, every potato touching the bottom of the dish was stuck and had to be pried off, leaving the best part of the potato - the crispy part. I read through several reviews and saw no mention of this issue. If there's a solution, I'd love to try this dish again.
I accidentally added a little too much oil, because I meant to half it, but it was so delicious, tender browned potato, crispy pealing! I topped it off with a dollop of sour cream.

Easy and flavorful! I took advice from several other reviewers. First, I gave the potatoes a little head start in the microwave. Only five minutes but that was a big help. I added kosher salt instead of regular and just mixed a bit of italian seasoning and garlic powder with fresh ground pepper into the olive oil. Tossed it all around in a bowl and got the potatoes nicely coated. The hot oven made them deliciously crisp on the outside and nice and soft and fluffy on the inside. I added some bits of onion during the last ten minutes and the flavor was amazing! My guys gave it rave reviews!
These are so easy to pull together and they melt in your mouth. I added some Rosemary pre-roasting.

My daughter is a very picky eater and this is one dish she begs me to make! A few things I do differently: 1/3 cup olive oil and after all the potatoes are face down on pan I sprinkle over them with Garlic Salt (this is what makes them so good!) They definitely need to be cooked longer. I bake them for 45 minutes and they are perfect

Turned out GREAT! Simple recipe with simple ingredients! I added some garlic powder and parsley. And I also added the onions(with 10 minutes left), and they were AWESOME!! LOL Thanks for the easy recipe.
Simple and tasty. A favorite.
So easy to make & super yummy! They turned out perfectly baked! The only difference is I added freshly chopped thyme. I will definitely make this again.

terrific. 
I did two things differently.
1. to speed it up I nuked the cut potatoes in the microwave for 3:30, which cut over time to 20 min.
2. I mixed in fresh rosemary from the garden. Delish. thanks!
The roasted new potatoes came out perfect. Thanks. The recipe was super easy.
What a wonderful simple recipe for new red potatoes. Reminds me of my childhood. I adjusted the recipe for one serving and they turned out yummy!

I made it just as the recipe called for.
My husband, said he thinks are these red Roasted Potatoes were the best he has ever had. We have only been married 58 Years!!
So think that deserves 5 stars.
CF
These potatoes were terrific! I followed the ingredient recipe exactly but put the potatoes in the microwave for 5 minutes before I mixed in the ingredients. I will definitely make these again.
Very good and so easy! I didn't change a thing.
I cut the potatoes into bite size and even the 20" roasting time was a bit too long,
Great!!!
Easy to make, and tasted great, makes a good weeknight side dish.
I added powdered garlic, minced onion, Italian seasoning. I roasted them longer, made them extra crispy. They were great.
Made these last night & my 14 year old loved them... compared them to Rally fries!! Even my husband loved them & even asked me how I made them.
Very good! Super easy.. I made the mistake in timing my dishes so I had to take it out a little earlier than I’d like.. though I did parboil them so they were still delicious!

I’m giving this 5 stars because this is the first recipe that gave me the trick to making the potatoes perfect... COOKING ON THE LOWEST RACK! My daughter begs for these all the time. I used garlic salt. My daughter said “YUM! These tase like the french fries from 5 guys”
Fantastic and easy - added fresh rosemary since I had it on hand
Easy and fast!
Very easy and yummy!! A keeper for sure!

Excellent and simple yet delicious recipe. I made this for my boyfriend and his parents for a steak dinner side dish and they all absolutely LOVED them. They kept asking me how I made them and what I put in them. My boyfriends mom is a great cook so for her to ask me how I made them and her telling me she loved them was a huge compliment. I will definitely be making these more. They are delicious.
I made mine with small russet potatoes. I also added Rosemary and Thyme seasoning. the house smells great while roasting.
I put on too much oil and it made the whole house smoky, but they were very good!!
I added rosemary leaves and dried parsley :)
Delicious
perfect!
So easy & so delicious! Looking forward to making again since they were so tasty.
Instead of salt and pepper I used Trader Joe's Everything But The Bagel Sesame seasoning. My family loved it!

Excellent and easy, good tips from other reviewers. I did the 3 minutes in the microwave to speed up a little, then 10 minutes followed by onion slices added on top (after tossing in oil and seasoning left behind from potatoes tossed in a bowl), then 12 minutes more. Will make again, no question!
A different way to make potatoes for me. I love that the slices were bigger than how I usually cut them.
Very good. I added a few sprinkles of Mrs.Dash afterwards to flavor them up a bit. They were a hit. Thanks for this simple, easy recipe. A keeper.
very easy and very good. a big hit!!!

Looking for recipes my husband will like during our coronavirus lock-in. I had a bag of fresh creamer Potatoes from the little potato company, and they were perfect for this recipe. I cut the potatoes in half and followed the original recipe, using ground salt and ground peppercorns, and also adding garlic powder to the mix. They took about a half an hour to roast and came out to perfection. Here is my tip: nest a big baking pan inside of another baking pan. This creates an air baking effect, keeps the potatoes from sticking or burning, and makes cleanup easy.
Was delicious and easy, I sprinkled some garlic salt on them
These were ok. I would make them again. However, I added more seasoning : oregano, thyme, minced garlic, rosemary, and onion. Without these this dish would be too bland.
Receipe was delicious. I used sea salt, rosemary, and basil.
very easy and delicious. I also added garlic powder. It was a hit!
Followed the recipe only added parsley to potatoes . It was a hit in my house !
I added a teaspoon of dried thyme.
I will do this again, but not on lowest oven rack. After 15 minutes they were burning and I needed to lower temp and raise rack. They were still very good, but lesson lesrned.

This recipe is so good! I used roasted garlic olive oil, cut the potatoes a little smaller because mine were larger than "small". Used a little more salt and some garlic pepper and added chopped red onions when 10 minutes were left for the potatoes to cook. Next time, I think I will add the onions and some fresh grated Parmesan cheese when 10 minutes are left - even more yummy!
I have prepared oven roasted potatoes in the past, this recipie I will now use more than ever. I don't usually roast red potatoes but I will from now on.
Easy delicious recipe; I will make again!
Very good, easy side dish. I add other veggies like onion chunks, & various types/colors peppers. I use Grapeseed oil or Avacado oil.
Yummo!
I made these exactly as written with the exception of adding Thyme & Oregano. I also cooked them for 20 min. added some onion, tossed and cooked the final 10. They were yummy and hubby loved them.
Made as directed. I will definitely make again. We love potatoes and this was a nice change
Followed exactly and the potatoes came out great.

I should have checked after 20 minutes because 30 was too long. Also, I have an electric range and I wonder if the fact that the element is above the stove bottom, whereas gas burns below, the pan should be placed on the second lowest level when using electric ranges.

I have used this several times. Each time a little different, but all have been good. I like to make mine a little more crispy so keep them in the oven 3 to 5 minutes longer. Easy side dish for many main courses.

The trick is the high temperature. Makes them very crispy with a great edge all the way around. We actually quartered the larger red potatoes, halved the smaller ones, added lots of crushed garlic, about 5 large cloves, and about 3 TBSP of fresh, chopped rosemary. We let the potatoes marinate for about an hour before baking and we turned them carefully a couple of times during baking.
easy and was great

Made per recipe, but with baby Yukon gold potatoes. Kids loved them...said they tasted like French fries! Was tempted to season with Montreal Steak Seasoning as I do with roasted veggies, glad I kept them simple.

Pretty bland. I don't understand why people gave it great reviews after saying that they added all these spices that were not in the original recipe? Obviously the potatoes were bland. I cut my potatoes in eights. In addition to the olive oil, salt and pepper, I added minced garlic, minced dried onions, sprinkle of mestique, garlic powder, Thyme, and red pepper flakes. Some members suggested Rosemary. I tried it, but didn't like it. I'm really not a fan of Rosemary. With the much needed spices, it tasted good.
Great, simple recipe. I added some dried thyme to the mix. The high temperature is a must! The potatoes came out delicious and crunchy.
Made as directed. It was only okay. I wouldn’t make it again though.
Great basic recipe. I also added garlic. leaving them in for the full time made them a bit mushier than how I like them.

I did not make any changes , they were good they way they are. I made them along with my meatloaf and some mixed vegetables. Wifey and a good friend both really liked it. That's good enough for me.
Thank you for the recipe. 
Bubba.
Easy!
Followed exactly. Very good. Will make again!
Tasted good. Did as others suggested, added some minced garlic and rosemary and cut into quarters. Came out perfectly done. Also, added onions and squash for the last 10 min. and it was perfect.
Very simple and quick way to have lovely roasted potatoes. I used red and gold thin skinned potatoes ,but stuck to the recipe other than that.
Easy but tastes great. Made with seasoned chicken, made the meal great.
Excelente...just follow the directions. Rosemary and garlic add a slightly more flavorful, elegant taste.

With just the 2 of us, I use our toaster oven for roasting. We typically eat one potato each and with a protein and vegetable, we are satisfied. I only need about 1Tablespoon of olive oil to cover with a couple of pinches of kosher salt and enough freshly ground black pepper to taste. I have added granulated CA style garlic powder (a couple of shakes) so far. My husband has declared that these are by far his favorite way to enjoy red potatoes. A definite keeper.

Absolutely delicious! As always, I look through the comments and ratings to see what others thought and how they adapted the recipe for themselves and I fully agree with several other posters to add the garlic, oregano, thyme and onion. However, I personally would put the onions in for the last 15 minutes as I would’ve liked to have had them soften up a bit more. Everyone in my home loved it, all three of my boys, my husband and myself... and we can sometimes be a tough crowd. I’ll definitely be making this again!
Excellent. My red potatoes were kinda large so I cut them into 1 inch pieces then followed the recipe exactly. Delicious!
Thank you for sharing this recipe! Simple, easy to make, and d-lish! This is in our regular rotation for dinner :)
Easy. Delicious. Tossed in some lemon juice. Leftovers with eggs in the morning!
Yummy, added rosemary, thyme, and cayenne pepper

Great recipe! Even my picky husband loved it I've used this recipe several times, and once for party of 30. Turned out great every time! I didn't change anything. This is definitely a keeper for my home!
I made this on the bottom rack at 400 degrees while also baking chicken on the middle rack. i cut the small red potatoes in quarters and it took about 25-30 minutes. they tasted great!
So easy and good. I did add garlic

I originally made these for my mom, yeah, me too.
No one, that has tried these, ever wants a baked potato again after tasting these.
Be very liberal with olive oil, salt and pepper.
Quick and easy
Tossed on parsley and grated Parmesan. Delicious!!!
I added some rosemary sprinkles but would be fine as is. Very addictive.
Simple and perfect. Delicious. I didn’t change a thing. If you change this recipe, dont rate it please. It’s not the same recipe if you change it.

I never knew how easy it was to make fabulous roasted potatoes. Before this recipe, my roasted potatoes were blah. Putting the cut side of the potato face down and the very high cook temp made all the difference.
I wouldn't change a thing other than maybe adding garlic powder.
Tender, tasty, and easy!
They were really good. My family enjoyed this recipe
I used garlic salt in place of the regular salt. Good, easy and few ingredients.
Will definitely make it again.
Super easy recipe! Easy to follow instructions and potatoes came out great. Would recommend!
Basic recipe is spot on. I added chopped garlic, paprika and thyme. Also the onions mentioned above are a MUST!
